segments.text: I feel a pang of sadness watching this scene unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman seems so disconnected from what’s happening around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just going through the motions, drying that plate like it’s the only thing that matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being kids, but they’re putting themselves in danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool, and the girl is just waiting for a cookie, completely unaware of the risks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like no one is really present in the moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s a different story.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would notice and fix things before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene just feels so lonely and disconnected.
segments.speaker: PAR
